item.title: AgSTAR Library of Tools and Resources
item.description:
The AgSTAR program provides a wide variety of resources and tools for stakeholders interested in exploring the use of anaerobic digester systems. Outreach materials and project development tools, information on funding resources, and information on digesters operating within the United States are listed below.

  • AgSTAR Projects, Case Studies and Vendors

    These resources provide information about farm-based anaerobic digester projects within the United States, including a directory of vendors.

    • Livestock Anaerobic Digester Database 
    • AgSTAR Project Profiles 
    • AgSTAR Case Studies 
    • Anaerobic Digestion Ombudsman Case Studies 
    • AgSTAR Vendor Directory: Develop Agricultural Biogas Recovery Systems 
  • Interviews with Anaerobic Digester Operators

    Operators of anaerobic digesters share first-hand feedback about their projects. 

    • Dane County, WI 
    • Ideal Family Farms, PA 
    • Reinford Farms Inc, PA 
    • RENERGY, OH 
    • Storms Farm, NC 
  • Technical Resources for Biogas Recovery Systems

    These resources provide technical information about anaerobic digestion and biogas recovery systems and are intended to help with planning and optimizing projects.

    • How Biogas Systems Work Exit
    • Recovering Value from Waste: Anaerobic Digester System Basics 
    • Basics of Energy Production through Anaerobic Digestion of Livestock Manure Exit
    • AgSTAR Handbook - A Manual For Developing Biogas Systems at Commercial Farms in U.S. Environmental Protection Agency the United States 
    • Anaerobic Digestion on Hog Operations 
    • Estimating Methane Reductions from Operating Anaerobic Digestion Systems 
    • Using Biochemical Methane Potentials and Anaerobic Toxicity Assays 
    • Increasing Anaerobic Digestion Performance with Codigestion 
    • Common Safety Practices for On-Farm Anaerobic Digestion Systems 
    • Interconnection Guidelines 
  • Industry Reports and Presentations

    These resources provide national market data and trends related to biogas recovery systems.

    • Biogas Opportunities Roadmap Report 
    • Improving Project Outcomes and Growing the Anaerobic Digestion Industry Report 
    • AgSTAR Market Opportunities Report 
    • Attracting Institutional and Impact Investors (presentation) 
    • Challenges and Opportunities for California’s Dairy Economy Exit
    • Dairy Manure Anaerobic Digester Feasibility Study Report Exit
  • Online Tools and Software

    Listed below are various tools to assist with project planning and identify potential incentives. The following links exit the site Exit

    • Database of State Incentives for Renewable Energy (DSIRE)
    • State Energy Portal Online for Consumers
    • RETScreen – Clean Energy Management Software
    • Biogas Economic Model and Toolkit
    • State Renewable Portfolio Standards and Goals
    • Cost of Renewable Energy Spreadsheet Tool (CREST) (National Renewable Energy Laboratory, 2011)
    • Biogas Research Database (ABC)
    • AD Budget Calculator
    • Anaerobic Digestion Financial Decision Tools
    • System Advisor Model (SAM) (National Renewable Energy Laboratory, 2010)
    • Power Purchase Agreement Toolkit (RETScreen International, 2012)
    • EPA WARM Tool -- tracking and reporting of emission reductions
  • Funding and Grant Sources

    The following information may assist you in funding an anaerobic digester project. Most of the following links exit the site Exit

    • Funding On-Farm Anaerobic Digestion
    • EIA, Feed-in tariff: A policy tool encouraging deployment of renewable electricity technologies 
    • USDA, Energy Matrix
    • USDA, Farm Service Agency Energy Programs – Biomass Crop Assistance Program
    • USDA, Natural Resources Conservation Service Funding Sources
    • USDA, Rural Energy for America Program
    • USDA, Rural Development Business Programs
    • USDA, Rural Development Value-Added Producer Grants (VAPG)
    • USDA, Sustainable Agriculture Research & Education Sustainable Agriculture Grants (SARE)
    • US DOE, Exploring Power Purchase Agreements: The Basics
  • Other Agencies and Organizations

    Visit these websites for additional information. The following links exit the site Exit

    • American Biogas Council Resources
    • U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Energy Website
    • U.S. Department of Energy’s Alternative Fuels Data Center
    • Center of Sustaining Agriculture and Natural Resources at Washington State University
    • Cornell University College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Dairy Environmental Systems
    • Penn State’s Renewable and Alternative Energy
    • RNG Coalition
    • Energy Vision
item.dc:creator: chris_bachman1

item.title: AgSTAR Vendor Directory for Agricultural Biogas Recovery Systems
item.description:
Related Links

AgSTAR’s Implement Anaerobic Digestion Projects offers project guidelines and financing information.

AgSTAR’s Partner Program supports relationships with state and non-governmental allies to promote planning, deployment and success of anaerobic digestion projects.

The Global Methane Initiative (GMI) Exit is available for organizations focusing on international activities. AgSTAR works in conjunction with GMI to promote anaerobic digestion globally.

The AgSTAR Vendor Directory is a valuable resource to locate leaders in anaerobic digestion, including:

  • Designers
  • Project developers
  • Energy service providers
  • Equipment manufacturers and distributors
  • Commodity organizations

AgSTAR Vendor Directory: Develop Agricultural Biogas Recovery Systems(100 pp, 914 K, June 2016)

Update or add information to the Vendor Directory by completing an online form.

Note: Vendor Directory information is provided by the listed organizations. EPA does not endorse any of the listed organizations or guarantee the accuracy of the information.
item.dc:creator: chris_bachman1
